sn10.7:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn10.7:4.2: Now at that time the Buddha was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dharma talk about extinguishment.
sn10.7:4.3: And the mendicants are paying attention, focusing, concentrating, and listening well.
sn10.7:4.4: Then the native spirit Punabbasu’s Mother soothed her little children, saying:
sn10.7:5.3: For I want to listen to the teaching
sn10.7:5.4: of the Teacher, the supreme Buddha.
sn10.7:6.1: Since the Blessed One spoke of extinguishment,
sn10.7:7.1: In this world, your own child is dear;
sn10.7:7.2: in this world, your own husband is dear;
sn10.7:7.3: but even greater than that is my love
sn10.7:8.2: dear as they are, can free you from suffering
sn10.7:8.3: as listening to the true teaching
sn10.7:9.1: In this world mired in suffering,
sn10.7:9.2: fettered by old age and death,
sn10.7:9.3: I want to listen to the teaching
sn10.7:9.5: which frees you from old age and death.
sn10.7:10.3: Pay attention just to the teaching,
sn10.7:10.4: for it’s nice to listen to the true teaching.
sn10.7:10.5: And it’s because we haven’t understood the teaching
sn10.7:10.6: that we’ve lived in suffering, Mom.
sn10.7:11.1: For those who are lost, gods and humans,
sn10.7:11.3: The Buddha, bearing his final body,
sn10.7:12.1: “It’s good that my child’s so astute,
sn10.7:12.2: this child I bore and suckled!
sn10.7:12.3: My child loves the pure teaching
sn10.7:13.4: I have seen the noble truths!”
